result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle K Lesueur was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 7-18-2015 and additional payments due the 18th of each month thereafter. If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Huber for work, school, and child care.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Danielle K Lesueur

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant requesting expungement.  (Danielle K. LeSueur, 3019A N 60th St, Milwaukee WI 53210).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy No Proof of Claim Deadline received from CMC on 6/30/16.  Bankruptcy case number 16-25944.  Bankruptcy filed 6/9/16.  All court cases include 11FO877 $131.87, 13CM162 $886, 14CM476 $443, 15CM786 $453, 15CM4343 $186.
Updated address from information on Notice of Chapter 7 Bankruptcy form.

Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, with 21 days credit for time served, with huber for work, school, and child care.  Court stays report date to 06-25-2015 by 5pm. 
Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges at the rate of $25.00 per month with the first payment due on 07-18-2015 and additional payments due the 18th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Court orders stayed bench warrant cancelled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for 04-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record.  Attorney Stewart is ill and unable to appear.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 46. jks  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SOUTHRIDGE MALL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Danielle K Lesueur in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge SIEFERT.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to RESERVED Br. 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
